TestCase.TestCase_Title: Copy and paste administrator categories from an inherited category to a owned location

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create two categories "Category0" and "Category1" within the "Orchestra" category
Create a "Category2" category in the root of the "AdminContext"
Copy categories to context root level
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Orchestra" category
In the context viewer, select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Copy" in the contextual menu
In the context viewer, right click on the "AdminContext' context and select "Paste"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Both "Category0" and "Category1" categories have been created in the root of the "AdminContext" context

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Copy categories to an owned category
In the context viewer, select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Copy" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Category2" category and select "Paste" in the contextual menu
Click on the "Category2" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Category2" category contains two categories: "Category0" and "Category1"

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Copy and paste administrator categories to the same location

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create two categories "Category0" and "Category1" within the "Orchestra" category
Create a "Category2" category in the root of the "AdminContext"
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Orchestra" category
In the variable viewer, select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Copy" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "Paste" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Both "Copy of Category0" and "Copy of Category1" categories have been created in the "Orchestra" category

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Copy and paste administrator categories from an owned location to an inherited category

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create two categories "Category0" and "Category1" at the root level of the "AdminContext" context
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Copy" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "Paste" in the contextual menu
Click on the "Orchestra" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Both "Category0" and "Category1" categories have been added to the "Orchestra" category

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Copy and paste user categories from an inherited category to a owned location

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Create two categories "Category0" and "Category1" within the "Orchestra" category
Create a "Category2" category in the root of the participation
Copy categories to context root level
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Orchestra" category
In the context viewer, select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Copy" in the contextual menu
In the context viewer, right click on the "Participation to AdminContext' context and select "Paste"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Both "Category0" and "Category1" categories have been created in the root of the "Participation to AdminContext" context

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Copy categories to an owned category
In the context viewer, select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Copy" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Category2" category and select "Paste" in the contextual menu
Click on the "Category2" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Category2" category contains two categories: "Category0" and "Category1"

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Copy and paste user categories to the same location

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Create two categories "Category0" and "Category1" within the "Orchestra" category
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Orchestra" category
In the variable viewer, select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Copy" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "Paste" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Both "Copy of Category0" and "Copy of Category1" categories have been created in the "Orchestra" category

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Copy and paste user categories from an owned location to an inherited category

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Create a "Category2" category in the root of the participation
Create two categories "Category0" and "Category1" within the "Category2" category
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Copy" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "Paste" in the contextual menu
Click on the "Orchestra" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Both "Category0" and "Category1" categories have been added to the "Orchestra" category

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create two categories "Category0" and "Category1" at the root level of the "AdminContext" context and save it
Create an administrator context called "InheritedAdminContext" with "AdminContext" as parent context and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "InheritedAdminContext" context in the context viewer
In context "InheritedAdminContext", select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Copy" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "Paste" in the contextual menu
Click on the "Orchestra" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Both "Category0" and "Category1" categories have been added to the "Orchestra" category

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Copy administrator categories in user mode

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create two categories "Category0" and "Category1" at the root level of the "AdminContext" context and save it
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Copy" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "Paste" in the contextual menu
Click on the "Orchestra" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Both "Category0" and "Category1" categories have been added to the "Orchestra" category

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create one category "Category0" at the root level of the "AdminContext" context and save it
Create an administrator context called "InheritedAdminContext" with "AdminContext" as parent context and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "InheritedAdminContext" context in the context viewer
In context "InheritedAdminContext", right click on the "Category0" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Cut" entry of the contextual menu is not available

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Cannot cut administrator categories in user mode

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create one category "Category0" at the root level of the "AdminContext" context and save it
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Category0" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Cut" entry of the contextual menu is not available

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Copy a category from one context to another

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create one category "Category0" at the root level of the "AdminContext" context and save it
Create an administrator context called "AdminContext2" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Create one category "Category1" at the root level of the "Participation to AdminContext" context
Create a participation to the "AdminContext2" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext2" and save
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Category0" category and select "Copy" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "AdminContext2" context and select "Paste" in the contextual menu
Unfold the "AdminContext2" context in the context viewer

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Category0" has been added to the "AdminContext2" context

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Copy" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Participation to AdminContext2" context and select "Paste" in the contextual menu
Unfold the "Participation AdminContext2" context in the context viewer

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Category1" has been added to the "Participation to AdminContext2" context

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Cut a category from one context to another

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create one category "Category0" at the root level of the "AdminContext" context
Create an administrator context called "AdminContext2" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Create one category "Category1" at the root level of the "Participation to AdminContext" context
Create a participation to the "AdminContext2" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext2"
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Category0" category and select "Cut" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "AdminContext2" context and select "Paste" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Category0" category has been removed from the "AdminContext" context

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Unfold the "AdminContext2" context in the context viewer

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Category0" category has been added to the "AdminContext2" context

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Cut" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Participation to AdminContext2" context and select "Paste" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Category1" category has been removed from the "AdminContext" context

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Unfold the "Participation AdminContext2" context in the context viewer

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Category1" category has been added to the "AdminContext2" context

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Cut and paste administrator categories from an inherited category to a owned location

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create two categories "Category0" and "Category1" within the "Orchestra" category
Create a "Category2" category in the root of the "AdminContext"
Cut categories to context root level
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Orchestra" category
In the context viewer, select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Cut" in the contextual menu
In the context viewer, right click on the "AdminContext' context and select "Paste"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Both "Category0" and "Category1" categories have been created in the root of the "AdminContext" context.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Cut categories to an owned category
In the context viewer, select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Cut" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Category2" category and select "Paste" in the contextual menu
Click on the "Category2" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Category2" category contains two categories: "Category0" and "Category1".

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Cut and paste administrator categories from an owned location to an inherited category

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create two categories "Category0" and "Category1" at the root level of the "AdminContext" context
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Cut" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "Paste" in the contextual menu
Click on the "Orchestra" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Both "Category0" and "Category1" categories have been added to the "Orchestra" category.

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Cut and paste user categories from an inherited category to a owned location

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Create two categories "Category0" and "Category1" within the "Orchestra" category
Create a "Category2" category in the root of the "AdminContext"
Cut categories to context root level
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Orchestra" category
In the context viewer, select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Cut" in the contextual menu
In the context viewer, right click on the "Participation to AdminContext' context and select "Paste"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Both "Category0" and "Category1" categories have been created in the root of the "Participation to AdminContext" context. The "Orchestra" category no longer contains "Category0" and "Category1" categories

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Cut categories to an owned category
In the context viewer, select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Cut" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Category2" category and select "Paste" in the contextual menu
Click on the "Category2" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Category2" category contains two categories: "Category0" and "Category1". The root level no longer contains "Category0" and "Category1" categories

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Cut and paste user categories from an owned location to an inherited category

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Create two categories "Category0" and "Category1" in the root of the "Participation to AdminContext" context
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Select both "Category0" and "Category1" categories
Right click on the "Category1" category and select "Cut" in the contextual menu
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "Paste" in the contextual menu
Click on the "Orchestra" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Both "Category0" and "Category1" categories have been added to the "Orchestra" category. The root level no longer contains "Category0" and "Category1" categories
